entity.description:
This workflow configures CIFS/SMB and NFSv3 service on a Storage Virtual Machine
Version 2.1.0 extends support for 'Bad Port Isolation' and is valid only for clusters running with Data ONTAP version 9.0.0 onwards.
Configuring CIFS and NFS services on a Storage Virtual Machine involves the following steps:
1) Create a new aggregate or using an existing one. 2) Create a new Storage Virtual Machine and setting up Active Directory account. 3) Create a new Data logical Interface and assign a data LIF to the existing failover group. 4) Setup CIFS and NFS service. 5) Using the default export policy for all the clients. Creating an export rule to provide full access and assign to default export-policy. 6) Create a name mapping.
Pre-requisites: ======== 1) NFS and CIFS licenses must be enabled. 2) Adding following entry into WFA Credentails (WFA portal -> Execution -> Credentials)
For AD Domain : ========== Match : select 'Exact' Type : select 'Other' Name/IP : enter Fully qualified Domain name User Name : enter domain Administrator Password : enter domain Administrator password
entity.name: Multiprotocol Server Configuration

entity.description:
This workflow set up multiprotocol file access for UNIX or Windows clients when the Security style of the volume is either NTFS or UNIX or MIXED. If security style of volume is UNIX:- 1) Create a new aggregate or using an existing one 2) Create/use export policy and rule 3) Create a new volume (flexvol | flexgroup) with export policy 4) Modify the junction path if necessary
If security style of volume is NTFS:- 1) Create a new aggregate or using an existing one 2) Create a volume (flexvol | flexgroup) 3) Modify the junction path if necessary 4) Create CIFS/SMB shares 5) Configure CIFS/SMB share permissions
If security style of volume is MIXED:- 1) Create a new aggregate or using an existing one 2) Create/use export policy and rule 3) Create a new volume (flexvol | flexgroup) with export policy 4) Modify the junction path if necessary 5) Create CIFS/SMB shares 6) Configure CIFS/SMB share permissions Note:- === a) To create new export policy, ensure the 'Do you want to create new export policy?' box is checked and required rules are added in 'Export Rule' table. If no rules are passed, a new policy will get created without any rules. b) To add an new rule to existing policy, select the policy from drop down, then add new rule into "Export Rule" table. Modification of existing rule is not possible. c) To use existing policy, select it from drop down and its associated rules will be applied to volume.
entity.name: Multiprotocol File Access

entity.description:
Finds an aggregate suitable for provisioning a destination volume for SnapMirror. The following filtering criteria are used:
1. Membership of a Resource pool: If a resource pool is supplied, aggregate must be a member of that resource pool.
2.Space Threshold: Fullness of the aggregate must not exceed the specified percentage threshold after the volume is provisioned.
3. Exclude root aggregates as identified by flags has-local-root and has-partner-root.
4. If the destination Storage Virtual Machine has its aggregate list populated, consider the aggregates from that list only.
5. Exclude the specified source aggregate.
6. Destination cluster's effective ONTAP version must be same or newer than the specified version.
When multiple aggregates satisfy all the filtering criteria, rank the aggregates as follows and select the top one:
1. Fault domain separation: Aggregate on a different node than the the specified node usually of the source aggreate.
2. Load balancing across the nodes of the cluster: Aggregate on a node with the least number of volumes.
3. Capacity balancing: Aggregate with the most free space.
entity.name: Find aggregate for SnapMirror destination volume

pack.name: WFA pack for managing Clustered Data ONTAP

pack.author: NetApp
pack.description:
The pack Clustered Data ONTAP storage management pack includes certified Workflow automation (WFA) content for managing clustered Data ONTAP storage systems. This pack is available at the Storage Automation Store.
This pack has the following benefits for effective data management of clustered Data ONTAP: - Defines the schema 'cm_storage' for clustered Data ONTAP by defining dictionary entries reflecting the object types in clustered Data ONTAP. - Provides a set of commands for storage and data management of clustered Data ONTAP systems. - Provides a set of commonly used filters, finders, templates, functions that can be used to develop workflows for data management of clustered Data ONTAP systems. - Includes a set of data source types that are SQL-based and enables you to obtain cached data from OnCommand Unified Manager 7.1. - Defines a schema 'cm_performance' that contains performance metrics for clustered Data ONTAP and a script-based data source types along with basic configuration data. - Provides certified workflows for managing clustered Data ONTAP. You can use the content in the pack as a foundation to develop further automation workflows for managing clustered Data ONTAP storage systems.

When creating an interval schedule, specify only the interval parameters and specify at least one of them. Interval schedules cannot be used for SnapMirror transfers.

entity.description:
Moves a Cluster-Mode volume from its current aggregate to the specified target aggregate.
This command initiates the move of the volume. Firstly, a series of checks are run to determine if the volume can be moved. If any of them throw a warning or error, the command fails.
Once the initial checks pass, the actual move is initiated where a destination volume is created and data is transferred using snapshots.
The cutover phase can be controlled by CutoverWindow, CutoverAttempts, CutoverAction. If CutoverAction is defer_on_failure which is the default, volume move job will try cutover until CutoverAttempts are exhausted and move into cutover_deferred state if it fails to cutover. If CutoverAction is abort_on_failure, the volume move job will try cutover until CutoverAttempts are exhausted and if it fails, a complete cleanup is performed.
entity.name: Move volume

entity.description:
Create schedules, snapshot policies and SnapMirror policies on the Clustered Data ONTAP including several general purpose ones and two policies meant to be used for 'SnapManager for Hyper-V' and 'SnapManager for Microsoft SQL Server' products.
The following schedules are created: -------------------------------------------- Every 15 minutes Every 30 minutes Every 30 minutes weekdays during work hours Hourly on the hour Hourly on half hour Every 2 hours Every 4 hours Every 8 hours Every 12 hours 11:00 pm on Sunday Monthly on 1st at 00:05am Yearly on December 31st at 11:55pm
The following snapshot policies are created: ---------------------------------------------------- wfaDefault: Snapshot policy for creating hourly, daily, weekly, monthly and yearly local snapshots.
The following SnapVault policies are created: ----------------------------------------------------- wfaSnapVaultDefault: SnapVault policy with hourly, daily, weekly, monthly and yearly snapshots on the SnapVault destination.
wfaSnapVaultAfterSnapMirror: SnapVault policy to be used for the second-hop SnapVault relationship.
wfaSnapVaultForSMSQL: SnapVault policy to be used for SnapVault relationship originating from a primary volume protected by 'SnapManager for Microsoft SQL Server'.
wfaSnapVaultForSMHV: SnapVault policy to be used for SnapVault relationship originating from a primary volume protected by 'SnapManager for Hyper-V'.
entity.name: Create Schedules and Policies

entity.description:
Modify SnapMirror changes one or more parameters of a SnapMirror or SnapVault relationship. The SnapMirror or SnapVault relationship is identified by its source and destination Clusters, Storage Virtual Machines, and Volumes and these must be specified as the command input parameters.
Changes made by the Modify SnapMirror command do not take effect until the next manual or scheduled update of the relationship. Changes do not affect updates that have started and have not finished yet. This command is not supported on Infinite Volume constituents.

Each SnapMirror Policy Rule has a aEURoeSnapMirror LabelaEUR? field. Clustered ONTAP transfers only the aEURoelabeledaEUR? source Snapshots to the SnapVault destination. If the source Snapshot does not have one of the SnapMirror labels specified in the aEURoeSnapMirror Policy RulesaEUR?, that source Snapshot is not transferred to the SnapVault destination. entity.description:
Starts a resync operation to re-establish a SnapMirror or SnapVault relationship between a source volume and a destination volume, typically in the following cases:
- The SnapMirror relationship is broken (that is, the destination volume is a read-write volume and no longer a data protection mirror).
- A required common Snapshot copy was deleted on the source volume causing SnapMirror or SnapVault updates to fail.
The resync operation runs in the background on the source and the destination clusters. This command does not wait for the operation to finish. After the resync operation completes, the SnapMirror or SnapVault relationship can be manually updated or scheduled for updates. The resync operation will fail if the destination volume does not have a Snapshot copy in common with the source volume.
This command requires Clustered Data ONTAP 8.2.0 or later.
Warning: The resync operation might cause data loss on the destination volume because this operation might remove the exported Snapshot copy on the destination volume.
entity.name: Resync SnapMirror

entity.description: SIS (Single Instance Storage) policy encapsulates the compression and deduplication scheduling for volumes and are applied on volumes.SIS policy is created on a Storage Virtual Machine.Only schedules of "cron" type can be associated with SIS policies.

entity.description:
Creates and configures a Storage Virtual Machine with Infinite Volume, creates the Infinite Volume, and sets up file access to the Storage Virtual Machine.
It performs the following setup step by step:
1) Create a Storage Virtual Machine and set up DNS, NFS and CIFS, if details are provided. FCP and iSCSI are blocked. 2) Take the existing LDAP client and configure it for the Storage Virtual Machine. 3) Set up NIS with servers provided. 4) If selected, set up an NFS server with default values. 5) If selected, set up a CIFS server with the Storage Virtual Machine name as the CIFS server name. 6) Create a data logical interface(LIF) to access these protocols. 7) If selected, delegate Storage Virtual Machine administration to a new user or existing 'vsadmin' user by unlocking. 8) Assign aggregates to be used by the Storage Virtual Machine. 9) If details are provided, create an interface for Storage Virtual Machine management. 10) Create an efficiency policy, that includes a preconfigured schedule. 11) Create an Infinite Volume of type 'rw'(read-write) or 'dp'(data protection) based on what the user selects. 12) Create export rules for the default export policy associated with the Infinite Volume.
If you create an Infinite Volume with storage classes, the Infinite Volume is created without any data constituents. You must add capacity to this Infinite Volume by using the workflows 'Add or expand capacity storage class to an Infinite Volume' and 'Add or expand performance storage class to an Infinite Volume'.
Pre-requisites: Add the following entry into WFA Credentials (WFA portal -> Execution -> Credentials):
1) For AD Domain:
Match: select 'Exact'. Type: select 'Other'. Name/IP: enter a fully qualified domain name. User Name: enter the domain Administrator user name. Password: enter the domain Administrator password.
2) To delegate Storage Virtual Machine administration to a new user or to an existing 'vsadmin' user. This is required only when Auth Method is 'password'.
Match: select 'Exact'. Type: select 'ONTAP'.
Name/IP: specify the Storage Virtual Machine's management logical interface IP address for Name/IP field. User Name: specify the Storage Virtual Machine administration user name. Specify it as 'vsadmin' if the 'vsadmin' user is to be unlocked. Auth Method should be 'password' if user is 'vsadmin'. Password: enter the password for the new user or the 'vsadmin' user.
entity.name: Create and configure a Storage Virtual Machine with Infinite Volume

entity.description: 'Transfer SnapMirror' performs the data transfer to the destination endpoint(volume) of an existing SnapMirror or SnapVault relationship. The SnapMirror or SnapVault relationship is identified by its destination triplet that are Destination Cluster, Destination Storage Virtual Machine, and Destination Volume and these must be specified as the command input parameters. This is performed after the snapmirror-create operation to initialize or update the destination volume. The initial transfer to an empty destination volume is a baseline transfer. Scheduled updates on a relationship cannot begin unless the destination has been explicitly initialized using this command. SnapMirror/SnapVault relationship should exist before the execution of this command. In the absence of the relationship command will fail with the error.
entity.name: Transfer SnapMirror

entity.description:
Adds or expand a capacity storage class to an Infinite Volume. The capacity storage class is defined by the following characteristics:
1. The data constituents are provisioned on aggregates with 'SATA' type of disks. 2. Data constituents are provisioned with a 'volume' space guarantee. 3. Data constituents have deduplication enabled with efficiency priority as 'background' and compression as 'inline'. Efficiency operations are scheduled to run from midnight - 6 AM.
entity.name: Add or expand capacity storage class to Infinite Volume

entity.description:
Creates a SnapMirror relationship from old destination to old source, that is in reverse direction and only when the original relationship is in broken-off state and then resync is done on the new reverse relationship. The new reverse relationship will have the same schedule, policy and max transfer rate as the old forward relationship.
This workflow requires Clustered Data ONTAP 8.2.0 or later.
Warning: The resync operation might cause data loss on the source volume because any new snapshots that were created after the common snapshot which is used to establish the new reverse relationship will be deleted.
entity.name: Reverse Resync SnapMirror relationship

Increases the size of the Cluster-Mode LUN according to the TargetSize string parameter value. The TargetSize parameter can be a pure number or can be prefixed with "+". If the prefix is "-" or if the pure number is smaller in MBytes than the current LUN size in MBytes the command will fail with: "This command cannot be used to decrease LUN size." Examples of valid values: , "500", "+10", "+30"
LUN can be attached to the QoS policy group only on cluster installed ONTAP version 8.2.0 and onwards.

entity.description:
Fetches results of the 'Move volume' command and takes action according to the findings.
First looks for the NcJob of type MOVE that was created by the 'Move Volume' command and according to its properties, takes action. For example, in case the 'Move Volume' command was invoked with wait param, or with the default aEUR~defer_on_failureaEUR(TM) and the cutovers did fail, then the Wait command will invoke a manual cutover.
The parameters to this command must be provided with the same values sent to the 'Move Volume' Command in order to fetch the correct NcJob.
entity.name: Wait for volume move

entity.description:
Compares one Data ONTAP release version against another.
Input parameters:
version1 - String - valid Data ONTAP release version that contains major and minor version numbers. Ex: 'Data ONTAP Release 8.0.1 7-Mode: Wed Jan 5 17:23:51 PST 2011', '8.2X23 Cluster-Mode', '8.1RC3', 'RollingRock__8.1.2 Cluster-Mode' etc. version2 - String - valid Data ONTAP release version that contains major and minor version numbers. compareMicro - boolean - specify if micro versions of the releases should be compared if major and minor versions are same for both release versions.
version1 is compared against version2, and 0 is returned if version1 is equal to version2 - Ex: compareOntapVersions("8.0.1RC3", "8.0.2RC1", false), compareOntapVersions("8.1.0RC1", "8.1.0RC3", false) -1 is returned if version1 is less than version2 - Ex: compareOntapVersions("Data ONTAP Release 8.1.0 Cluster-Mode", "8.2.0RC1", true), Ex: compareOntapVersions("8.0.1RC3", "8.0.2RC1", true) 1 is returned if version1 is greater than version2 - Ex: compareOntapVersions("8.2RC3", "8.1RC1", true)
entity.name: compareOntapVersions

entity.description:
This workflow will setup NFSv3 file access for UNIX clients when the security style of the volume is UNIX. It performs following tasks.
1) Create a new aggregate or use an existing one. 2) Create or use existing policy. 3) Create a new volume (flexvol | flexgroup) with export policy created. 4) Modifies the junction path if necessary.
Note:- ==== a) To create new export policy, ensure the 'Do you want to create new export policy?' box is checked and required rules are added in 'Export Rule' table. If no rules are passed, a new policy will get created without any rules. b) To add a new rule to existing policy, select the policy from drop down, then add new rule into "Export Rule" table. Modification of existing rule is not possible. c) To use existing policy, select it from drop down and its associated rules will be applied to volume.
entity.name: NFSv3 File Access

Add or expands performance storage class to an Infinite Volume. The performance storage class is defined by the following characteristics:
1. The data constituents are provisioned on aggregates with 'SAS' type of disks. 2. Data constituents are provisioned with a 'volume' space guarantee. 3. Data constituents have deduplication enabled with efficiency priority as 'background'. Compression is not enabled. Efficiency operations are scheduled to run on weekends from 6 AM - midnight.
entity.name: Add or expand performance storage class to Infinite Volume

entity.name: Remove QoS policy group

entity.description:
Creates a new Clustered Data ONTAP volume (flexvol | flexgroup) in the selected Storage Virtual Machine and exports the volume over NFS by associating it with an export policy. This workflow includes:
- Optionally creating an export policy containing a set of export rules, or selecting an export policy that already exists on the Storage Virtual Machine. Providing a new name for the export policy creates a new export policy. - Export rules have settings related to the set of hosts that can access the volume with read-write, root or read only permissions and the associated security style for these accesses. - Creating a new volume with the specified name and associating it with the export policy. - Mounting the newly created volume in the Storage Virtual Machine namespace at the specified junction path.
entity.name: Create a Clustered Data ONTAP NFS Volume

entity.description: Object representing the association between a snapshot policy and its schedules. Atmost, there can be 5 schedules associated with a snapshot policy.

entity.description:
Sets up a cluster peer relationship between two clusters. Cluster peering facility allows two clusters to exchange data and request remote operations. It is a mandatory pre-requisite for SnapMirror data to flow between two clusters. This workflow includes:
- Creating an intercluster interface on each of ports specified for both of the clusters. Provide at least one or two (recommended) port names on each node of each cluster to create the intercluster LIFs. - The logical interfaces are named incrementally using the provided prefix and the IP Addresses are also configured incrementally using the starting IP Address provided by the user. - Ports provided can be either intercluster ports or data ports. Use of intercluster ports can ensure that intercluster traffic is segregated from the main data traffic.
entity.name: Establish Cluster Peering

entity.description: Add a rule to a SnapMirror Policy on the Clustered ONTAP. aEURoeSnapMirror Policy RuleaEUR? determines the retention settings of the Snapshots on the SnapVault destination. Each SnapMirror Policy Rule has a aEURoeSnapMirror LabelaEUR? field. Clustered ONTAP transfers only the aEURoelabeledaEUR? source Snapshots to the SnapVault destination. If the source Snapshot does not have one of the SnapMirror labels specified in the aEURoeSnapMirror Policy RulesaEUR?, that source Snapshot is not transferred to the SnapVault destination. Source volume has a aEURoeSnapshot PolicyaEUR? which has a schedule for creating local snapshots. SnapMirror label specified in the aEURoeSnapshot Policy ScheduleaEUR? of the source volume is applied to all the Snapshots created by that schedule. The same SnapMirror label is used in the aEURoeSnapMirror Policy RuleaEUR? to specify the retention settings for those Snapshots on the SnapVault destination.
entity.name: Add rule to SnapMirror policy

entity.description:
This workflow sets up a data protection mirror relationship for an Infinite Volume. This workflow will:
- Associate a specific snapshot policy with the Infinite Volume. - Enable tape backup by enabling the SnapDiff option. This creates a namespace mirror constituent on every node of the cluster.
- Set up a SnapMirror relationship for the provided primary (rw) Infinite Volume and secondary (dp) Infinite Volume by performing the following steps:
a. Create a peering relationship between source and destination clusters using the existing intercluster LIFs. If a cluster peer relationship is already established, this step is skipped. b. Create a peering relationship between the source and destination Storage Virtual Machine Virtual Machines. c. Establish a SnapMirror relationship is established between the primary and secondary Infinite Volumes. d. Wait for SnapMirror initialization to complete.
entity.name: Setup data protection for an Infinite Volume

entity.description: Finds an aggregate, that is not aggr0, that is in the given cluster and has the given available capacity (MB). The Cluster is identified its name.

entity.description:
Creates a 64-bit aggregate on a given node of a cluster
Aggregate will be created using the available spare disks on the node.
Since aggregate creation may involve zero-ing of disks, which is a time consuming activity, use 'Wait for Aggregate online' command along with this command to wait until the new aggregate to come online.
entity.name: Create aggregate

entity.description: Modify a cron or an interval schedule on Clustered ONTAP. Only the specified parameters are modified. Parameters that are not specified are left alone. For a cron schedule, specify only the cron parameters. For interval schedule, specify only the interval parameters. Name, type and description of the schedule cannot be modified.
entity.name: Modify schedule

entity.description:
Replace an old HA pair on a cluster with a new HA pair along with attached disk shelves. The data volumes located on the source HA pair will be moved to the destination HA pair in a non-disruptive manner using the volume move feature within Data ONTAP. Once the data volumes have been moved from the source HA pair, the NAS and cluster management network interfaces will be moved to the destination HA pair. The source HA pair will be removed from the storage cluster.
Before executing the workflow, please make sure that the following pre-requisites are met.
Pre-requisites: 1) Install the new HA pair nodes and add it to the cluster. 2) Please ensure that the maximum cluster size limits are not exceeded. See the Data ONTAP System Administration Guide for Cluster Administrators for information about cluster limits on non-SAN environments. For SAN environments, see the Data ONTAP SAN Configuration Guide for Clustered Data ONTAP. 3) Configure the new nodes as a HA-pair. 4) Install all necessary licenses on the new HA-pair. 5) Ensure that the network ports on new HA pair are configured properly. Identify the network ports to be used for data network interfaces and cluster-management interfaces. Ensure that the ports are connected to the appropriate networks. 6) For SAN logical interfaces: a) Create matching SAN logical interfaces on the new HA pair for each SAN logical interface on the old HA pair. b) Ensure that SAN logical interfaces on the destination are members of the appropriate portsets. c) If required, modify the iSCSI and FCP initiators to add the newly defined SAN logical interfaces. 7) Create data aggregates on the new HA pair nodes. Each destination node should have data aggregates big enough to host the volumes from the corresponding source node. The workflow will allow customized mapping of source aggregates to destination aggregates 8) Make sure that the cluster is added to OCUM server and the cluster and the new controllers are discovered by the OCUM server. 9) Make sure that the OCUM server is added to the WFA server and cache is acquisition is complete with the new HA pair details. 10) Add the cluster credentials to WFA server. 11) If your clusters are running Data ONTAP 8.3, ensure that your port mapping is of the same IPspace and broadcast domain.
entity.name: Controller and shelf upgrade of an HA pair

entity.description:
The command will wait until the given aggregate comes online.
If Node and Aggregate parameters are not given, the command will wait until all the aggregates in the given cluster to come online.
If Node parameter is given and Aggregate parameter is not given, the command will wait for all the aggregates in the given node to come online.
If Aggregate parameter is given, the command will wait for the given aggregate to come online.
entity.name: Wait for aggregate online

entity.description:
This command waits for the cluster refresh to complete on the specified OnCommand Unified Manager server. It checks the status of the cluster refresh using the cluster refresh Job ID set by the 'Refresh cluster on OnCommand Unified Manager server' command.
The OnCommand Unified Manager server parameter must be supplied with the same value that was set in the 'Refresh cluster on OnCommand Unified Manager server' command in order to fetch the correct Job ID.
Prerequisite:
Add credentials of your OnCommand Unified Manager server in WFA->Credentials as below:
Match: Exact Type: OnCommand Unified Manager Name/IP: <OCUM server IP> Username: <User Name> Password: <User Password>
entity.name: Wait for cluster refresh on OnCommand Unified Manager server

Provide aggregate name to relocate specific aggregate to destination node
Provide source node details and leave aggregate details empty to relocate all cluster-mode aggregates(SFO) from source node to destination node

entity.description:
This workflow starts a resync operation to re-establish a SnapMirror or SnapVault relationship between a source volume and a destination volume, typically in the following cases:
- The SnapMirror relationship is broken (that is, the destination volume is a read-write volume and no longer a data protection mirror).
- A required common Snapshot copy was deleted on the source volume causing SnapMirror or SnapVault updates to fail.
The resync operation runs in the background on the source and destination clusters. This workflow does not wait for the operation to finish. After the resync operation completes, the SnapMirror or SnapVault relationship can be manually updated or scheduled for updates. The resync operation will fail if the destination volume does not have a Snapshot copy in common with the source volume.
This workflow requires Clustered Data ONTAP 8.2.0 or later.
Warning: The resync operation might cause data loss on the destination volume because this operation might remove the exported Snapshot copy on the destination volume.
entity.name: Resync SnapMirror relationship

entity.description:
Sets up a Storage Virtual Machine for serving FCP and iSCSI protocols. The workflow performs the below tasks based on the inputs provided by user. - Creates the Storage Virtual Machine - Configures the Storage Virtual Machine with allowed protocols, allowed aggregates, maximum volume count and DNS settings - Sets up iSCSI and FCP services based on user choice - Creates a management logical interface and enables the vsadmin user or configures a new user for Storage Virtual Machine administration if user chooses to delegate the Storage Virtual Machine administration - Creates a iSCSI type portset for iSCSI logical interfaces - Creates logical interfaces for iSCSI protocol on each node of the Cluster - Adds iSCSI logical interfaces to iSCSI portset - Creates a FCP type portset for FCP logical interfaces - Creates logical interfaces for FCP protocol on each node of the cluster - Adds FCP logical interfaces to FCP portset
Pre-requisites: In case Storage Virtual Machine administration is to be delegated, then the password for admin user needs to be mentioned by creating new credentials for Storage Virtual Machine's management logical interface through WFA portal -> Execution -> Credentials. Workflow would access that password during execution while enabling/creating administration user for the Storage Virtual Machine. While creating the new credentials for Storage Virtual Machine administration user - Select 'Exact' for Match field. - Select 'ONTAP' for Type field. - Specify Storage Virtual Machine's management logical interface IP address for Name/Ip field. A pattern that can work for this IP address can also be specified. - Specify Storage Virtual Machine adminsitration user name for User name field. Specify it as 'vsadmin' if vsadmin user is to be unlocked. - Specify a password for Password field.
entity.name: Create and configure SAN Storage Virtual Machine

entity.description:
Creates one or more LUNs on Clustered Data ONTAP storage systems. This workflow includes:
- Creating a primary volume. - Creating one or more LUNs in the newly created volume. - Mapping the LUNs to either a newly created igroup or to a specified existing igroup. - Creates a secondary volume and creates a SnapMirror relationship between the primary and secondary volume.
Pre-requisites: - Cluster peer is required in case the SnapMirror secondary cluster is a different cluster than primary. Cluster peering between primary and secondary clusters can be established using "Establish Cluster Peering" sample workflow. - Storage Virtual Machine peer is required in case SnapMirror secondary Storage Virtual Machine is a different Storage Virtual Machine than primary, and both primary and secondary clusters are running ONTAP version 8.2.0 or above. Storage Virtual Machine peering between primary and secondary Storage Virtual Machines can be established using "Create Storage Virtual Machine peer" command.
entity.name: Create, map, and protect Clustered Data ONTAP LUNs with SnapMirror

entity.description:
Finds an aggregate suitable for provisioning a destination volume for SnapMirror. The following filtering criteria are used:
1. Membership of a Resource pool: If a resource pool is supplied, aggregate must be a member of that resource pool.
2.Space Threshold: Fullness of the aggregate must not exceed the specified percentage threshold after the volume is provisioned.
3. Exclude root aggregates as identified by flags has-local-root and has-partner-root.
4. If the destination Storage Virtual Machine has its aggregate list populated, consider the aggregates from that list only.
5. Exclude the specified source aggregate.
6. Destination cluster's effective ONTAP version must be same or newer than the specified version.
When multiple aggregates satisfy all the filtering criteria, rank the aggregates as follows and select the top one:
1. Fault domain separation: Aggregate on a different node than the the specified node usually of the source aggreate.
2. Load balancing across the nodes of the cluster: Aggregate on a node with the least number of volumes.
3. Capacity balancing: Aggregate with the most free space.
entity.name: Find aggregate for SnapMirror destination volume

entity.description:
This command creates an active directory account in the given domain on the specified Storage Virtual Machine. If there exists a CIFS server for the requested Storage Virtual Machine, then it will fail with an error message saying, "A CIFS server already exists for this Storage Virtual MachineaEUR?. In such cases delete the existing CIFS server and try the command again.
Requirements: ------------------ 1. DNS should be configured properly for this command to succeed. The cluster or Storage Virtual Machine should be able to ping the fully qualified domain name (FQDN).
2. WFA credentials should be created for the FQDN of the domain. These credentials need to be of a domain user that has the ability to add the Active Directory Account configured on the Storage Virtual Machine to the target organizational unit.
entity.name: Setup Active Directory account

entity.description:
Finds an aggregate suitable for provisioning a destination volume for SnapVault. The following filtering criteria are used:
1. Membership of a Resource pool: If a resource pool is supplied, aggregate must be a member of that resource pool.
2.Space Threshold: Fullness of the aggregate must not exceed the specified percentage threshold after the volume is provisioned.
3. Exclude root aggregates as identified by flags has-local-root and has-partner-root.
4. If the destination Storage Virtual Machine has its aggregate list populated, consider the aggregates from that list only.
5. Exclude the specified source aggregate.
6. Destination cluster's effective ONTAP version must be same or newer than the specified version.
7. Block type: SnapVault requires 64-bit aggregates. 32-bit aggregates are not supported.
When multiple aggregates satisfy all the filtering criteria, rank the aggregates as follows and select the top one:
1. Fault domain separation: Aggregate on a different node than the the specified node usually of the source aggreate.
2. Load balancing across the nodes of the cluster: Aggregate on a node with the least number of volumes.
3. Capacity balancing: Aggregate with the most free space.
entity.name: Find aggregate for SnapVault destination volume

entity.description:
This command will monitor active volume move operations on a given node.
If the number of active volume move operations on the given node is below the specified limit, the command will return successfully. Otherwise the command will wait until the number of active volume moves is below the limit.
This command will consider the volume move operations which have the given node as source or destination.
If parameter ErrorIfUnsuccessful is true, the command will check for the presence of unsuccessful volume move jobs on the given node. If there are any such jobs, the command will error out without waiting.
entity.name: Wait for multiple volume moves

entity.description:
This workflow configures CIFS/SMB and NFSv3 service on a Storage Virtual Machine
Version 2.1.0 extends support for 'Bad Port Isolation' and is valid only for clusters running with Data ONTAP version 9.0.0 onwards.
Configuring CIFS and NFS services on a Storage Virtual Machine involves the following steps:
1) Create a new aggregate or using an existing one. 2) Create a new Storage Virtual Machine and setting up Active Directory account. 3) Create a new Data logical Interface and assign a data LIF to the existing failover group. 4) Setup CIFS and NFS service. 5) Using the default export policy for all the clients. Creating an export rule to provide full access and assign to default export-policy. 6) Create a name mapping.
Pre-requisites: ======== 1) NFS and CIFS licenses must be enabled. 2) Adding following entry into WFA Credentails (WFA portal -> Execution -> Credentials)
For AD Domain : ========== Match : select 'Exact' Type : select 'Other' Name/IP : enter Fully qualified Domain name User Name : enter domain Administrator Password : enter domain Administrator password
entity.name: Multiprotocol Server Configuration

2) For across Cluster SVM peering add both cluster Credentials, with in cluster add one cluster credentials (WFA portal -> Execution -> Credentials)
For adding Cluster Credentials :
Match : select 'Exact' Type : select 'ONTAP' Name/IP : enter Fully qualified Domain name User Name : enter Cluster Administrator login Password : enter Cluster Administrator password
entity.name: Storage Virtual Machine Peering

entity.description:
This workflow set up multiprotocol file access for UNIX or Windows clients when the Security style of the volume is either NTFS or UNIX or MIXED. If security style of volume is UNIX:- 1) Create a new aggregate or using an existing one 2) Create/use export policy and rule 3) Create a new volume (flexvol | flexgroup) with export policy 4) Modify the junction path if necessary
If security style of volume is NTFS:- 1) Create a new aggregate or using an existing one 2) Create a volume (flexvol | flexgroup) 3) Modify the junction path if necessary 4) Create CIFS/SMB shares 5) Configure CIFS/SMB share permissions
If security style of volume is MIXED:- 1) Create a new aggregate or using an existing one 2) Create/use export policy and rule 3) Create a new volume (flexvol | flexgroup) with export policy 4) Modify the junction path if necessary 5) Create CIFS/SMB shares 6) Configure CIFS/SMB share permissions Note:- === a) To create new export policy, ensure the 'Do you want to create new export policy?' box is checked and required rules are added in 'Export Rule' table. If no rules are passed, a new policy will get created without any rules. b) To add an new rule to existing policy, select the policy from drop down, then add new rule into "Export Rule" table. Modification of existing rule is not possible. c) To use existing policy, select it from drop down and its associated rules will be applied to volume.
entity.name: Multiprotocol File Access

entity.description:
Create an Active Directory based CIFS server with the given options. The command also supports setting up CIFS in a Storage Virtual Machine context
Requirements: ------------------ 1. DNS should be configured properly for this command to succeed. The cluster or Storage Virtual Machine should be able to ping the domain FQDN.
2. WFA credentials should be created for the FQDN of the domain. These credentials need to be of a domain user that has the ability to add the CIFS server configured on the Storage Virtual Machine to the target organizational unit.
entity.name: Setup CIFS service

Add credentials of your OnCommand Unified Manager server in WFA->Credentials as below: Match: Exact Type: OnCommand Unified Manager Name/IP: <OCUM server IP> Username: <User Name> Password: <User Password>

A new credential entry should be created through WFA credentials (WFA portal -> Execution -> Credentials) page as below. Match : select 'Exact' Type : select 'ONTAP' Name/IP : Specify Storage Virtual Machine's management logical interface IP address for Name/Ip field. User Name : Specify Storage Virtual Machine administration user name. Specify it as 'vsadmin' if 'vsadmin' user is to be unlocked. Password : enter password for new user or 'vsadmin' user

entity.description:
This workflow will create and configure NAS Storage Virtual Machine. Command will allow NFS and/or CIFS setup on a new Storage Virtual Machine. FCP and iSCSI will be blocked on this Storage Virtual Machine. It will do following setup step by step 1) Create a Storage Virtual Machine along with DNS setup if provided 2) Modify Storage Virtual Machine to allow NFS and CIFS and block FCP and iSCSI 3) Take existing LDAP client and configure it for Storage Virtual Machine 4) Setup NIS with servers provided 5) If selected, setup NFS service with default values 6) If selected, setup CIFS with Storage Virtual Machine Name as a CIFS server name 7)Create a data Logical Interface to access these protocols 8)If requested, it will delegate Storage Virtual Machine administration to new user or existing vsadmin user by unlocking 9) It will also delegate aggregates to be used by Storage Virtual Machine and limit on number of volumes to be created on Storage Virtual Machine 10) If details are provided, workflow will create interface for Storage Virtual Machine management
Pre-requisites: Adding following entry into WFA Credentails (WFA portal -> Execution -> Credentials)
1) For AD Domain :
Match : select 'Exact' Type : select 'Other' Name/IP : enter Fully qualified Domain name User Name : enter domain Administrator Password : enter domain Administrator password
2) To delegate Storage Virtual Machine administration to New User or to existing 'vsadmin' User. Required only when Auth Method is 'password'
Match : select 'Exact' Type : select 'ONTAP' Name/IP : Specify Storage Virtual Machine's management logical interface IP address for Name/Ip field. User Name : Specify Storage Virtual Machine administration user name. Specify it as 'vsadmin' if 'vsadmin' user is to be unlocked. Auth Method should be 'password' if user is 'vsadmin' Password : enter password for new user or 'vsadmin' user
entity.name: Create and configure NAS Storage Virtual Machine

entity.description: Returns all aggregates excluding the aggregates in the specified cluster. Typically used to ensure that aggregates from a source cluster are not selected when choosing aggregates to create replica volumes.
entity.name: Filter aggregates excluding the specified cluster

entity.description:
Fetches the results of the 'Create SnapMirror' command and reports the SnapMirror relationship initialization progress.
For Clustered ONTAP 8.1 relationship, the command first looks for the NcJob of type aEUR(TM)Transfer-InitializeaEUR~ that was created by the 'Create SnapMirror' command and that is assigned to the given source and destination locations. After finding the job, it reports on its progress. The parameters must be supplied with the same values sent to the 'Create SnapMirror' command in order to fetch the correct NcJob.
For Clustered ONTAP 8.2 relationship, the command waits until the state of the relationship changes to 'snapmirrored'.
entity.name: Wait for SnapMirror initialization or resync

entity.description:
The aEUR~Release SnapMirroraEUR(TM) command removes a SnapMirror relationship on the source endpoint. It unlocks and cleans up the snapshots pertaining to the relationship. It does not destroy any volume. One must specify the destination endpoint when using aEUR~Release SnapMirroraEUR(TM). This command must be executed on the source Storage Virtual Machine or source cluster following the deletion of the relationship on the destination Storage Virtual Machine or destination cluster. It is possible to issue aEUR~Release SnapMirroraEUR(TM) on the source Storage Virtual Machine without deleting the relationship on the destination Storage Virtual Machine. However, the relationship will continue to exist because the destination is the authority. The relationship will reappear on the source on the next transfer.
Minimum ONTAP version is 8.2.0 for this command.
entity.name: Release SnapMirror

entity.description:
Sets up a SnapMirror relationship for a Clustered Data ONTAP volume hosted on a cluster. This workflow includes:
- Creating a SnapMirror destination volume on the chosen secondary Storage Virtual Machine. - Configuring a SnapMirror relationship with a selected schedule for periodic updates to the relationship. - Storage Virtual machine peering is optional.
Pre-requisites: Cluster peer is required in case the SnapMirror secondary is a different cluster than primary. Cluster peering between primary and secondary clusters can be established using "Establish Cluster Peering" sample workflow.
entity.name: Create Storage Virtual Machine Peer and SnapMirror

entity.description:
This workflow will demonstrate the feature of how to use user input of type 'password'. It will create a basic Storage Virtual Machine. Configure active directory service in SVM and then delegate that SVM to the 'domain' user with specific role (e.g. 'vsadmin'). It performs the below tasks based on the inputs provided by user.
1) Creating a Storage Virtual Machine. 2) Creating Data Logical Interface. 3) Adding DNS entry for the created SVM. 4) Adding Active Directory service. 5) Creating Management Logical Interface. 6) Delegate aggregates to be used by SVM. 7) Limit on number of volumes to be created on SVM. 8) Delegating the SVM to the 'domain' user with the role being specified.
Prerequisites:- AD server should be accessible with proper credentials.
NOTE:- The workflow is not qualified for IPv6.
entity.name: Create Basic Storage Virtual Machine And Delegate To 'domain' User

entity.description: Creates a Storage Virtual Machine peer relationship. Storage Virtual Machine peering allows SnapMirror relationships to be formed between volumes on two Storage Virtual Machines in the same or different clusters. The Storage Virtual Machines may be on the same or different Clustered ONTAP storage systems. Both Storage Virtual Machines must exist prior to this command being executed.
entity.name: Create Storage Virtual Machine peer

entity.description:
Create a SnapMirror relationship for the specified volume and then create a SnapVault relationship from the SnapMirror destination volume that was just provisioned. Select suitable aggregates for provisioning the destination volumes from the specified resource pools. If the resource pool is not specified (value = "NONE"), all available aggregates on the specified destination cluster are considered for provisioning. A peering relationship is created between source and destintaion clusters using the existing intercluster LIFs. Also, a peering relationship is created between source and destination Storage Virtual Machines.
SnapVault relationship in aEURoeSnapMirror then SnapVault cascadeaEUR? has a different snapshot retention behavior than the SnapVault relationship that originates from a primary volume. The difference is that only SnapMirror-created snapshots are transferred to the SnapVault destination by the transfer schedule attached to the second-hop SnapVault relationship. If there is no policy attached to the second-hop SnapVault relationship, up to 251 SnapMirror-created snapshots are retained on the SnapVault destination. Retention count of those snapshots can be specified by attaching a policy with a special aEUR~sm_createdaEUR(TM) label to the second-hop SnapVault relationship.
entity.name: Create SnapMirror then SnapVault cascade

entity.description:

If the destination port is not given, the network interface will be migrated to a port on the destination node with the port name the same as that of the port on which the LIF currently resides.
This command can also be used to migrate network interface to a different port on the same cluster node.
entity.name: Migrate logical interface

pack.name: WFA pack for managing Clustered Data ONTAP

pack.author: NetApp
pack.description:
The SLO workflow pack provides a framework for implementing SLO and Adaptive QoS policy manager. Storage service providers can use the SLO pack to optimize utilization, performance modelling, trend analysis, and asset planning. The SLO pack includes six workflows. They are classified and included in the following two categories: Service Level Management and Service Level based Provisioning.
Workflows in the Service Level Management category enable you to define Storage Service Level Classes, Protection Service Level Classes, and setup and run Adaptive QoS Policy Manager which can be associated with every provisioned volume and LUN. Workflows in the Service Level based Provisioning category enable you to provision LUN, or volume based on defined services and also enable you to move volume from one storage service level to another storage service level.
The three workflows in Service Level Management category must be executed in the following recommended sequence: 1. Service Catalog Initialization (Mandatory) 2. Manage Storage and Adaptive QoS Service Configuration (Mandatory and Iterative) 3. Manage Protection Service Level Class (Optional)
The following three workflows in the Service Level based Provisioning category are used as consumer workflows: 1. Provision Volume based on a Service Level (Optional and Iterative) 2. Provision LUN Based on a Service Level (Optional and Iterative) 3. Move Volumes to a New Storage Service Level Class (Optional and Iterative) You can execute these workflows as per your requirement.
CAUTION: NetApp strongly recommends that the customers attend the Service Design Workshop (SDW) conducted at their site before using the SLO pack. Please contact your account team to schedule the SDW. If the SLO pack is used without attending the SDW, then it is done so at the risk of the Customer and against NetApp's recommendation.

Workflow will allow following set of values for every SSLC i. IOPS throttle (IOPS/TB) ii. initial IOPS throttle iii. Dedupe enabled/disabled iv. Compression enabled v. Thick or Thin Provisioing

pack.name: Service Level Objective

pack.author: NetApp
pack.description:
The pack, "WFA content for managing Data ONTAP in 7-Mode storage systems , contains certified WFA content for managing storage systems running Data ONTAP in 7-Mode. This pack is available in the Storage Automation Store and is also pre-shipped along with the WFA 4.0 onwards.
The pack has the following value-adds for effective data management of storage systems running Data ONTAP in 7-Mode: - It defines the schema 'storage' for Data ONTAP in 7-mode by defining dictionary entries reflecting the object types in Data ONTAP in 7-mode. - It provides a set of commands for storage and data management of Data ONTAP in 7-Mode. - It provides a set of commonly used filters, finders, templates, functions that can be used to develop workflows. - It contains a set of data source types that are SQL-based and enables you to obtain cached data from OnCommand Unified Manager 5.x - Along with basic configuration data, it also defines a schema 'performance' which contains performance metrics for Data ONTAP in 7-Mode and script based data source types that pull data from Performance Advisor that is part of OnCommand Unified Manager core Package 5.x. - It provides a set of certified workflows for managing Data ONTAP in 7-Mode storage systems. The content in the pack can be used as a foundation to develop further automation workflows for managing Data ONTAP 7-Mode storage systems.

entity.name: Create an NFS Volume in a vFiler

entity.description:
Calculates the size of snap reserve in percentage as a function of the volume size and the snap space percentage.
Snap Reserve value is calculated using the following algorithm: - Calculate the target_free_space threshold for the volume_size - Calculate data_and_backup_size as volume_size * target_free_space - Calculate data_size as data_and_backup_size* ( (100-snap_space_percentage)/100 ) - Calculate snap_reserve as (volume_size - data_size) / volume_size * 100
Input parameters: volume_size - Integer - size of the volume in MB snap_space_percentage - Integer - required snap space as a percentage of the data size
entity.name: calculateSnapReserveSize

entity.description:
Compares one Data ONTAP release version against another.
Input parameters:
version1 - String - valid Data ONTAP release version that contains major and minor version numbers. Ex: 'Data ONTAP Release 8.0.1 7-Mode: Wed Jan 5 17:23:51 PST 2011', '8.2X23 Cluster-Mode', '8.1RC3', 'RollingRock__8.1.2 Cluster-Mode' etc. version2 - String - valid Data ONTAP release version that contains major and minor version numbers. compareMicro - boolean - specify if micro versions of the releases should be compared if major and minor versions are same for both release versions.
version1 is compared against version2, and 0 is returned if version1 is equal to version2 - Ex: compareOntapVersions("8.0.1RC3", "8.0.2RC1", false), compareOntapVersions("8.1.0RC1", "8.1.0RC3", false) -1 is returned if version1 is less than version2 - Ex: compareOntapVersions("Data ONTAP Release 8.1.0 Cluster-Mode", "8.2.0RC1", true), Ex: compareOntapVersions("8.0.1RC3", "8.0.2RC1", true) 1 is returned if version1 is greater than version2 - Ex: compareOntapVersions("8.2RC3", "8.1RC1", true)
entity.name: compareOntapVersions

entity.description:
Calculates the required volume size based on the size of the data and the required percentage of snapshot space.
The following algorithm is used: - Calculate the total space required for data and backups using the following formula: data_and_backup_size = data_size*1.01 / ( (100-snap_space_percentage)/100 ) - Calculate the target_free_space threshold required for the data_and_backup_size using the below guidelines: 85% if data_and_bakcup_size is less than 17GB (which is 85% of 20GB) 90% if data_and_bakcup_size is equal to or greater than 17GB and less than 90GB (which is 90% of 100GB) 92% if data_and_bakcup_size is equal or greater than 90GB and less than 460GB (which is 92% of 500GB) 95% if data_and_bakcup_size is equal to or greater than 460GB and less than 972.8GB (which is 95% of 1TB) 98% if data_and_bakcup_size is equal to or greater than 972.8GB - Calculate the total required volume size using the following formula: data_and_backup_size / target_free_space
Note: the minimum volume size is 20MB.
Input parameters: data_size - Integer - size of data (file system or LUN(s)) in MB snap_space_percentage - Integer - required space for snapshots as a percentage of the size of the data (and not the size of the volume)
entity.name: calculateVolumeSizeFromDataSize

target_free_space value equals: - 15% if volume size is less than 20GB - 10% if volume size is equal to or greater than 20GB and less than 100GB - 8% if volume size is equal to or greater than 100GB and less than 500GB - 5% if volume size is equal to or greater than 500GB and less than 1TB - 2% if volume size is equal to or greater than 1TB
Input parameters: volume_size - Integer - size of the volume in MB

- Creating new destination volumes for both of the source volumes being migrated. - Establishing a Volume SnapMirror (VSM) relationship between the source and destination volumes and waiting for baseline transfer to complete. - Removing all exports and CIFS shares from the source volumes - Performing one final SnapMirror update to the established SnapMirror relationships - Breaking the SnapMirror relationship

pack.description: This pack contains two workflows to set up the FC service on a Storage Virtual Machine (SVM, formerly known as Vserver), in preparation for provisioning a LUN for use as a datastore using an FC HBA the host computer (Windows or ESX). Following are the workflows contained in the pack: 1. FCP server configuration for Windows and ESX 2. FCP LUN provisioning for Windows and ESX

entity.description: A set of workflows for storage provisioning in 7-Mode and Clustered Data ONTAP storage systems. This includes workflows which provision storage objects like volumes, LUNs, qtrees, configure NFS exports, create CIFS shares, create igroups and map provisioned LUNs to those igroups.
entity.name: Storage Provisioning

entity.description: Add or Remove Initiators from Igroup
entity.name: Modify Initiator Group

entity.description: A set of workflows that help setup the storage environment.
entity.name: Setup

entity.description:
Provisioning one or more LUNs on Clustered Data ONTAP storage systems for Windows and ESX. This workflow includes:
- Creating a new aggregate or use existing one. - Creating a new volume or use existing one. - Creating a new igroup or use/modify existing one. - Creating one or more LUNs. - Mapping the LUNs to either a newly created igroup or to a specified existing igroup.
entity.name: FCP LUN Provisioning

entity.description:
This workflow configures FCP service on a Storage Virtual Machine.
Configuring FCP services on a Storage Virtual Machine involves the following steps: 1. Creating a new aggregate or using an existing one. 2. Creating a new Storage Virtual Machine and setting up Active Directory account. 3. Setting up FCP service. 4. Creating a Portset. 5. Creating a FCP Logical Interface. 6. Adding FCP Logical Interface to Portset.
Pre-requisites:
1) FCP license must be enabled.
entity.name: FCP Server Configuration

pack.name: Fibre Channel server configuration and provisioning pack

pack.author: NetApp
pack.description:
During the process of storage consolidation in your data center, you need to migrate data from third-party LUNs to a NetApp cluster. This pack contains four workflows that enable you to migrate data from third-party LUNs to a NetApp cluster using Foreign LUN Import (FLI) functionality. These packs support both Online and Offline FLI.
The workflows in this pack should be executed in the following recommended sequence: 1. FLI Setup And Import 2. FLI Status And Restart 3. FLI Post Jobs 4. FLI Report
Prerequisites:
1. You must have installed WFA 3.1 2. You must ensure that OnCommand Unified Manager 6.3 is added as a data source in your WFA
This pack contains a configuration file called "data-collector_lun_import_ext.conf". You can obtain the same from any help content of the workflows. The configuration file must be placed in the following location as per the OS selected for the Unified Manager: i. Windows user: C:\Program Files\NetApp\ocum\etc\data-collector ii. Linux\Virtual Appliance (vApp) user (with root login): /opt/netapp/ocum/etc/data-collector/

entity.description:
This workflow breaks the LUN import relationships from the cluster and also deletes any LUN of a failed LUN import operation.
Deletion of LUN import relationship involves the following steps: 1. Deleting LUN import relationship for selected LUN import 2. Making LUN online if stated 3. Deleting LUN from ONTAP for failed LUN import
Prerequisites:
1) Destination SVM and Igroup should be available 2) Destination FlexVol should be available 3) Ensure that FCP logical interface is available on all nodes 4) WFA Server: WFA 3.1 5) ONTAP Version: 8.3.1 and above 6) UM Version: 6.3
entity.name: FLI Post Jobs

entity.description: Generates a database report for a specific database table under a specific database schema.
entity.name: Database Report Genarator

entity.description:
This workflow enables you to import data from foreign RAID array LUNs to cluster LUNs.
Migration of foreign LUNs involves the following steps: 1. Marking disk's as foreign 2. Creating LUNs by size of foreign disk 3. Making LUNs offline 4. Mapping newly created LUNs to existing I-group 5. Creating LUN import with/without throttle 6. Starting of LUN imports (Offline/Online) 7. Verification of LUN imports (Offline)
Prerequisites:
1) Destination SVM and Igroup should be available 2) Destination FlexVol should be available 3) Ensure that FCP logical interface is available on all nodes 4) WFA Server: WFA 3.1 5) ONTAP Vsersion: 8.3.1 and above 6) UM Version: 6.3
entity.name: FLI Setup And Import

entity.description: A disk path in a storage system.
entity.name: Disk_Path

entity.description: This workflow generates a status report of the LUN import in the form of CSV. A file in the following format <lun_report_dd_mm_yyyy__hh_mm_ss.csv> will be created at the location, WFA Installation Directory->jboss->standalone->tmp.
entity.name: FLI Report
Lun_Import for query OnCommand Unified Manager_6.3

entity.description:
This workflow is a helper workflow for the workflow "FLI Setup And Import". This workflow enables you to manage LUN migration jobs. You can also use this workflow to start LUN import operation.
Workflow displays all migration jobs (IN_PROGRESS, FAILED, STOPPED, PAUSED and COMPLETED). You can perform the following actions: 1. Starting migration jobs which are stopped (stopped/not yet started) 2. Pausing migration jobs which are active or failed 3. Resuming migration jobs which are paused 4. Stopping migration jobs (import/verification) which are active or failed 5. Modifying throttle value (on any migration job) 6. Changing of import state (offline -> online and vice-versa) when the import is stopped, paused 7. Verifying already completed import
Prerequisites:
1) Destination SVM and Igroup should be available 2) Destination FlexVol should be available 3) Ensure that FCP logical interface is available on all nodes 4) WFA Server: WFA 3.1 5) ONTAP Vsersion: 8.3.1 and above 6) UM Version: 6.3
entity.name: FLI Status And Restart

entity.description: Maps the LUN to all the initiators in the specified initiator group.
entity.name: LUN Map

entity.description: Creates a single unmapped LUN of foreign disk size on a Storage Virtual Machine.
entity.name: LUN Create by Size of Foreign Disk

entity.description: Information of a Foreign LUN Import relationship.
entity.name: Lun_Import

entity.description:
This command will monitor active LUN import operations on a given node.
If the number of active LUN import operations on the given node is below the specified limit, the command will return successfully. Otherwise the command will wait until the number of LUN import is below the limit.
entity.name: Wait for LUN Import and Verify

entity.description: Unmaps a Cluster-Mode LUN from an igroup.
entity.name: LUN Unmap

entity.description: Destroy the specified LUN. This operation will fail if the LUN is currently mapped and is online. The force option can be used to destroy it regardless of being online or mapped.
entity.name: LUN Delete
Disk_Path for query OnCommand Unified Manager_6.3

entity.description: This command used to change LUN state (offline -> online and online -> offline) on basis of 'ChangeState' selected. If ChangeState is 'offline' then -> Disables block-protocol accesses to the LUN. Mappings, if any, configured for the LUN are not altered. If ChangeState is 'online' then -> Re-enables block-protocol accesses to the LUN.
entity.name: Change LUN State

entity.description: This command used to perform different 'lun import' operations. 'create' - Create a LUN import relationship with the purpose of importing foreign disk data into the LUN 'delete' - Deletes the import relationship of the specified LUN or the specified foreign disk 'start' - Start the import for the specified LUN 'pause' - Pause the import for the specified LUN 'resume' - Resume the import for the specified LUN 'stop' - Stop and abort the import for the specified LUN. All import checkpoint data will be lost 'throttle' - Modify the max throughput limit for the specified import relationship 'verify-start' - Start the verification of the foreign disk and LUN data. The import admin/operational state must be stopped/stopped or started/completed. The verification does a block for block comparison of the LUN and foreign disk. If the verification detects a mismatch between the foreign disk and LUN then the verify will stop 'verify-stop' - Stop the verify for the specified LUN
entity.name: LUN Import

entity.description: Modify the attributes of storage-disk object. A true value indicates an array LUN has been designated as a foreign LUN and cannot be assigned
entity.name: Modify Storage Disk

entity.description: A set of workflows that help manage storage. This includes workflows for resizing storage, migrating volumes from their current locations to other storage systems and aggregates, and moving volumes non-disruptively in Cluster-Mode.
entity.name: Migration

pack.name: Foreign LUN Import

pack.author: NetApp
pack.description: The SLO workflow pack provides a framework for implementing SLOs. Using the SLO workflow pack, storage service providers can optimize utilization, performance modelling, trend analysis, and asset planning. This pack consists of nine workflows and enables you to define Service Levels Classes, Storage Service Level Classes, and Protection Service Level Classes, which can be associated with every provisioned volume and LUN. Service-based provisioning workflows enable you to provision LUN, or volume based on defined services. The workflows in the SLO pack should be executed in the following recommended sequence: (1) Service Catalog Initialization (Mandatory) (2) Manage Storage Service Level Class (Mandatory and Iterative) (3) Manage Protection Service Level Class (Optional) (4) Manage Service Level Class (Optional) (5) Manage Adaptive QoS Policy Configuration (Optional) (6) Adaptive QoS Service Manager (Mandatory) (7) Service Based Volume Provisioning (Optional and Iterative) (8) Provisioning LUN Based on a Service Level (Optional and Iterative) (9) Move Volumes to a New Storage Service Level Class (Optional and Iterative) Caution NetApp strongly recommends that the customer attend the Service Design Workshop (SDW) conducted at their site before using this Pack. Please contact your account team to schedule the SDW. Using this pack without attending the SDW, is done so at the risk of the Customer and against NetApp's recommendation.

entity.description: Return a volume details needed for creating a volume for storage service
entity.name: Filter volume by Storage Service

entity.description: This command will check if table to keep node details exists, if not it will create a table.
entity.name: Create QoS Node Table

entity.name: Create Service Level Class Table

entity.description: KP Script Setup
entity.name: KP Uninstall

entity.description: This will provide setup of workflows which will provision volume and LUN based on service levels
entity.name: Service Level based Provisioning

entity.description: This workflow manages Qos Policy Service. It Starts/Stops QoS Policy service
entity.name: Adaptive Qos Service Manager

entity.description:
This workflow will take Service Level Class(SLC) finds associated Storage Service Level Class(SSLC) and Protection Service Level Class (PSLC) or specific SSLC and PSLC and takes care of volume provisioning.
Workflow will understand the PSLC topology and prepares entire protection setup for volume as per given topology.
entity.name: Service based volume provisoning

entity.description: This command will handle Add/Remove/Update actions on storage service levels

entity.description: This Command can Add/start/stop/remove QoS policy manager service

entity.description: KP Script Setup
entity.name: KP Setup

entity.description:
This workflow will provide following functionalities 1) Define a new SSLC 2) Update existing SSLC 3) Remove existing SSLC 3) Remove Aggregate from SSLC
Workflow will allow following set of values for every SSLC i. IOPS throttle (IOPS/TB) ii. initial IOPS throttle iii. Dedupe enabled/disabled iv. Compression enabled v. Thick or Thin Provisioing
IOPS throttle and initial IOPS throttle setting will be used by Adaptive QoS Policy manager service to handle performance of the volume provisioned using service based volume provisioing workflow
Workflow will list down available aggregates. Select one or more aggregates to map it to specific SSLC.
Mapped aggregate list allow you to remove one or more aggregates from SSLC.
Note : This workflow is mandatory workflow to setup environment. Use this workflow for mapping aggregates to Storage service levels
entity.name: Manage Storage Service Level Class

entity.description: This command will insert/update/delete QoS default values in the table 'qos_default_values' under playground.

entity.description: This command will check if table to keep "Aggregate to Service Map" details exits. If not it will create.
entity.name: Create Aggregate to Service Map table

entity.description: This command will handle Add/Remove/Update actions on Protection Service Levels(PSL)
entity.name: Manage Protection Service

entity.description: This will look for aggregate by Service Level Catalog

QoS Config File Manager (Default Service Level)

entity.description:
This workflow will help in creating a Service Level Class with specific Storage Service and Protection Service.
Note : This workflow is not mandatory workflow. "Service Catalog Initialization" adds some SLCs, Use this workflow only when you want new SLC with different conbination of SSLC and PSLC
entity.name: Managing Service Level Class

entity.description:
This workflow will manage protection service level. Following functionalities are provided with this workflow 1) You can Add new Protection Service Level Class(PSLC) 2) You can Remove a Protection Service Level Class 3) You can Update the Protection Service Level Class 3) You can Add an Edge to a PSLC topology, Modify existing Edge in a topology and Remove an Edge in a topology OR Select "No Edge' when only primary retention policy is required
Note : 'Service Catalog Initialization' workflow will add 5 protection service level classes. Use this workflow to edit parameters of those services or for adding NEW PSLC
entity.name: Manage Protection Service Level Class
