Creating a new Storage Virtual Machine and setting up Active Directory account. 3. Setting up FCP service. 4. Creating a Portset. 5. Creating a FCP Logical Interface. 6. Adding FCP Logical Interface to Portset.
Pre-requisites:
1) FCP license must be enabled.
entity.name: FCP Server Configuration

pack.name: Fibre Channel server configuration and provisioning pack

pack.author: NetApp
pack.description:
During the process of storage consolidation in your data center, you need to migrate data from third-party LUNs to a NetApp cluster. This pack contains four workflows that enable you to migrate data from third-party LUNs to a NetApp cluster using Foreign LUN Import (FLI) functionality. These packs support both Online and Offline FLI.
The workflows in this pack should be executed in the following recommended sequence: 1. FLI Setup And Import 2. FLI Status And Restart 3. FLI Post Jobs 4. FLI Report
Prerequisites:
1. You must have installed WFA 3.1 2. You must ensure that OnCommand Unified Manager 6.3 is added as a data source in your WFA
This pack contains a configuration file called "data-collector_lun_import_ext.conf". You can obtain the same from any help content of the workflows. The configuration file must be placed in the following location as per the OS selected for the Unified Manager: i. Windows user: C:\Program Files\NetApp\ocum\etc\data-collector ii. Linux\Virtual Appliance (vApp) user (with root login): /opt/netapp/ocum/etc/data-collector/

entity.description:
This workflow breaks the LUN import relationships from the cluster and also deletes any LUN of a failed LUN import operation.
Deletion of LUN import relationship involves the following steps: 1. Deleting LUN import relationship for selected LUN import 2. Making LUN online if stated 3. Deleting LUN from ONTAP for failed LUN import
Prerequisites:
1) Destination SVM and Igroup should be available 2) Destination FlexVol should be available 3) Ensure that FCP logical interface is available on all nodes 4) WFA Server: WFA 3.1 5) ONTAP Version: 8.3.1 and above 6) UM Version: 6.3
entity.name: FLI Post Jobs

entity.description: Generates a database report for a specific database table under a specific database schema.
entity.name: Database Report Genarator

entity.description:
This workflow enables you to import data from foreign RAID array LUNs to cluster LUNs.
Migration of foreign LUNs involves the following steps: 1. Marking disk's as foreign 2. Creating LUNs by size of foreign disk 3. Making LUNs offline 4. Mapping newly created LUNs to existing I-group 5. Creating LUN import with/without throttle 6. Starting of LUN imports (Offline/Online) 7. Verification of LUN imports (Offline)
Prerequisites:
1) Destination SVM and Igroup should be available 2) Destination FlexVol should be available 3) Ensure that FCP logical interface is available on all nodes 4) WFA Server: WFA 3.1 5) ONTAP Vsersion: 8.3.1 and above 6) UM Version: 6.3
entity.name: FLI Setup And Import

entity.description: A disk path in a storage system.
entity.name: Disk_Path

entity.description: This workflow generates a status report of the LUN import in the form of CSV. A file in the following format <lun_report_dd_mm_yyyy__hh_mm_ss.csv> will be created at the location, WFA Installation Directory->jboss->standalone->tmp.
entity.name: FLI Report
Lun_Import for query OnCommand Unified Manager_6.3

entity.description:
This workflow is a helper workflow for the workflow "FLI Setup And Import". This workflow enables you to manage LUN migration jobs. You can also use this workflow to start LUN import operation.
Workflow displays all migration jobs (IN_PROGRESS, FAILED, STOPPED, PAUSED and COMPLETED). You can perform the following actions: 1. Starting migration jobs which are stopped (stopped/not yet started) 2. Pausing migration jobs which are active or failed 3. Resuming migration jobs which are paused 4. Stopping migration jobs (import/verification) which are active or failed 5. Modifying throttle value (on any migration job) 6. Changing of import state (offline -> online and vice-versa) when the import is stopped, paused 7. Verifying already completed import
Prerequisites:
1) Destination SVM and Igroup should be available 2) Destination FlexVol should be available 3) Ensure that FCP logical interface is available on all nodes 4) WFA Server: WFA 3.1 5) ONTAP Vsersion: 8.3.1 and above 6) UM Version: 6.3
entity.name: FLI Status And Restart

entity.description: Maps the LUN to all the initiators in the specified initiator group.
entity.name: LUN Map

entity.description: Creates a single unmapped LUN of foreign disk size on a Storage Virtual Machine.
entity.name: LUN Create by Size of Foreign Disk

entity.description: Information of a Foreign LUN Import relationship.
entity.name: Lun_Import

entity.description:
This command will monitor active LUN import operations on a given node.
If the number of active LUN import operations on the given node is below the specified limit, the command will return successfully. Otherwise the command will wait until the number of LUN import is below the limit.
entity.name: Wait for LUN Import and Verify

entity.description: Unmaps a Cluster-Mode LUN from an igroup.
entity.name: LUN Unmap

entity.description: Destroy the specified LUN. This operation will fail if the LUN is currently mapped and is online. The force option can be used to destroy it regardless of being online or mapped.
entity.name: LUN Delete
Disk_Path for query OnCommand Unified Manager_6.3

entity.description: This command used to change LUN state (offline -> online and online -> offline) on basis of 'ChangeState' selected. If ChangeState is 'offline' then -> Disables block-protocol accesses to the LUN. Mappings, if any, configured for the LUN are not altered. If ChangeState is 'online' then -> Re-enables block-protocol accesses to the LUN.
entity.name: Change LUN State

entity.description: This command used to perform different 'lun import' operations. 'create' - Create a LUN import relationship with the purpose of importing foreign disk data into the LUN 'delete' - Deletes the import relationship of the specified LUN or the specified foreign disk 'start' - Start the import for the specified LUN 'pause' - Pause the import for the specified LUN 'resume' - Resume the import for the specified LUN 'stop' - Stop and abort the import for the specified LUN. All import checkpoint data will be lost 'throttle' - Modify the max throughput limit for the specified import relationship 'verify-start' - Start the verification of the foreign disk and LUN data. The import admin/operational state must be stopped/stopped or started/completed. The verification does a block for block comparison of the LUN and foreign disk. If the verification detects a mismatch between the foreign disk and LUN then the verify will stop 'verify-stop' - Stop the verify for the specified LUN
entity.name: LUN Import

entity.description: Modify the attributes of storage-disk object. A true value indicates an array LUN has been designated as a foreign LUN and cannot be assigned
entity.name: Modify Storage Disk

entity.description: A set of workflows that help manage storage. This includes workflows for resizing storage, migrating volumes from their current locations to other storage systems and aggregates, and moving volumes non-disruptively in Cluster-Mode.
entity.name: Migration

pack.name: Foreign LUN Import

pack.author: NetApp
pack.description: This pack contains two workflows to set up the FC service on a Storage Virtual Machine (SVM, formerly known as Vserver), in preparation for provisioning a LUN for use as a datastore using an FC HBA the host computer (Windows or ESX). Following are the workflows contained in the pack: 1. FCP server configuration for Windows and ESX 2. FCP LUN provisioning for Windows and ESX

entity.description: A set of workflows for storage provisioning in 7-Mode and Clustered Data ONTAP storage systems. This includes workflows which provision storage objects like volumes, LUNs, qtrees, configure NFS exports, create CIFS shares, create igroups and map provisioned LUNs to those igroups.
entity.name: Storage Provisioning

entity.description: Add or Remove Initiators from Igroup
entity.name: Modify Initiator Group

entity.description: A set of workflows that help setup the storage environment.
entity.name: Setup

entity.description:
Provisioning one or more LUNs on Clustered Data ONTAP storage systems for Windows and ESX. This workflow includes:
- Creating a new aggregate or use existing one. - Creating a new volume or use existing one. - Creating a new igroup or use/modify existing one. - Creating one or more LUNs. - Mapping the LUNs to either a newly created igroup or to a specified existing igroup.
entity.name: FCP LUN Provisioning

entity.description:
This workflow configures FCP service on a Storage Virtual Machine.
Configuring FCP services on a Storage Virtual Machine involves the following steps: 1. Creating a new aggregate or using an existing one. 2. Creating a new Storage Virtual Machine and setting up Active Directory account. 3. Setting up FCP service. 4. Creating a Portset. 5. Creating a FCP Logical Interface. 6. Adding FCP Logical Interface to Portset.
Pre-requisites:
1) FCP license must be enabled.
entity.name: FCP Server Configuration

pack.name: Fibre Channel server configuration and provisioning pack

pack.author: NetApp
pack.description: The SLO workflow pack provides a framework for implementing SLOs. Using the SLO workflow pack, storage service providers can optimize utilization, performance modelling, trend analysis, and asset planning. This pack consists of nine workflows and enables you to define Service Levels Classes, Storage Service Level Classes, and Protection Service Level Classes, which can be associated with every provisioned volume and LUN. Service-based provisioning workflows enable you to provision LUN, or volume based on defined services. The workflows in the SLO pack should be executed in the following recommended sequence: (1) Service Catalog Initialization (Mandatory) (2) Manage Storage Service Level Class (Mandatory and Iterative) (3) Manage Protection Service Level Class (Optional) (4) Manage Service Level Class (Optional) (5) Manage Adaptive QoS Policy Configuration (Optional) (6) Adaptive QoS Service Manager (Mandatory) (7) Service Based Volume Provisioning (Optional and Iterative) (8) Provisioning LUN Based on a Service Level (Optional and Iterative) (9) Move Volumes to a New Storage Service Level Class (Optional and Iterative) Caution NetApp strongly recommends that the customer attend the Service Design Workshop (SDW) conducted at their site before using this Pack. Please contact your account team to schedule the SDW. Using this pack without attending the SDW, is done so at the risk of the Customer and against NetApp's recommendation.

Workflow will understand the PSLC topology and prepares entire protection setup for volume as per given topology.

entity.name: KP Setup

entity.description:
This workflow will provide following functionalities 1) Define a new SSLC 2) Update existing SSLC 3) Remove existing SSLC 3) Remove Aggregate from SSLC
Workflow will allow following set of values for every SSLC i. IOPS throttle (IOPS/TB) ii. initial IOPS throttle iii. Dedupe enabled/disabled iv. Compression enabled v. Thick or Thin Provisioing
IOPS throttle and initial IOPS throttle setting will be used by Adaptive QoS Policy manager service to handle performance of the volume provisioned using service based volume provisioing workflow
Workflow will list down available aggregates. Select one or more aggregates to map it to specific SSLC.
Mapped aggregate list allow you to remove one or more aggregates from SSLC.
Note : This workflow is mandatory workflow to setup environment. Use this workflow for mapping aggregates to Storage service levels
entity.name: Manage Storage Service Level Class

entity.description:

Following functionalities are provided with this workflow 1) You can Add new Protection Service Level Class(PSLC) 2) You can Remove a Protection Service Level Class 3) You can Update the Protection Service Level Class 3) You can Add an Edge to a PSLC topology, Modify existing Edge in a topology and Remove an Edge in a topology OR Select "No Edge' when only primary retention policy is required
Note : 'Service Catalog Initialization' workflow will add 5 protection service level classes. Use this workflow to edit parameters of those services or for adding NEW PSLC
entity.name: Manage Protection Service Level Class

Following functionalities are provided with this workflow 1) You can Add new Protection Service Level Class(PSLC) 2) You can Remove a Protection Service Level Class 3) You can Update the Protection Service Level Class 3) You can Add an Edge to a PSLC topology, Modify existing Edge in a topology and Remove an Edge in a topology OR Select "No Edge' when only primary retention policy is required
Note : 'Service Catalog Initialization' workflow will add 5 protection service level classes. Use this workflow to edit parameters of those services or for adding NEW PSLC
entity.name: Manage Protection Service Level Class

pack.name: Service Level Objective

pack.author: NetApp
pack.description:
During the process of storage consolidation in your data center, you need to migrate data from third-party LUNs to a NetApp cluster. This pack contains four workflows that enable you to migrate data from third-party LUNs to a NetApp cluster using Foreign LUN Import (FLI) functionality. These packs support both Online and Offline FLI.
The workflows in this pack should be executed in the following recommended sequence: 1. FLI Setup And Import 2. FLI Status And Restart 3. FLI Post Jobs 4. FLI Report
Prerequisites:
1. You must have installed WFA 3.1 2. You must ensure that OnCommand Unified Manager 6.3 is added as a data source in your WFA
This pack contains a configuration file called "data-collector_lun_import_ext.conf". You can obtain the same from any help content of the workflows. The configuration file must be placed in the following location as per the OS selected for the Unified Manager: i. Windows user: C:\Program Files\NetApp\ocum\etc\data-collector ii. Linux\Virtual Appliance (vApp) user (with root login): /opt/netapp/ocum/etc/data-collector/

entity.description:
This workflow breaks the LUN import relationships from the cluster and also deletes any LUN of a failed LUN import operation.
Deletion of LUN import relationship involves the following steps: 1. Deleting LUN import relationship for selected LUN import 2. Making LUN online if stated 3. Deleting LUN from ONTAP for failed LUN import
Prerequisites:
1) Destination SVM and Igroup should be available 2) Destination FlexVol should be available 3) Ensure that FCP logical interface is available on all nodes 4) WFA Server: WFA 3.1 5) ONTAP Version: 8.3.1 and above 6) UM Version: 6.3
entity.name: FLI Post Jobs

entity.description: Generates a database report for a specific database table under a specific database schema.
entity.name: Database Report Genarator

entity.description:
This workflow enables you to import data from foreign RAID array LUNs to cluster LUNs.
Migration of foreign LUNs involves the following steps: 1. Marking disk's as foreign 2. Creating LUNs by size of foreign disk 3. Making LUNs offline 4. Mapping newly created LUNs to existing I-group 5. Creating LUN import with/without throttle 6. Starting of LUN imports (Offline/Online) 7. Verification of LUN imports (Offline)
Prerequisites:
1) Destination SVM and Igroup should be available 2) Destination FlexVol should be available 3) Ensure that FCP logical interface is available on all nodes 4) WFA Server: WFA 3.1 5) ONTAP Vsersion: 8.3.1 and above 6) UM Version: 6.3
entity.name: FLI Setup And Import

entity.description: A disk path in a storage system.
entity.name: Disk_Path

entity.description: This workflow generates a status report of the LUN import in the form of CSV. A file in the following format <lun_report_dd_mm_yyyy__hh_mm_ss.csv> will be created at the location, WFA Installation Directory->jboss->standalone->tmp.
entity.name: FLI Report
Lun_Import for query OnCommand Unified Manager_6.3

entity.description:
This workflow is a helper workflow for the workflow "FLI Setup And Import". This workflow enables you to manage LUN migration jobs. You can also use this workflow to start LUN import operation.
Workflow displays all migration jobs (IN_PROGRESS, FAILED, STOPPED, PAUSED and COMPLETED). You can perform the following actions: 1. Starting migration jobs which are stopped (stopped/not yet started) 2. Pausing migration jobs which are active or failed 3. Resuming migration jobs which are paused 4. Stopping migration jobs (import/verification) which are active or failed 5. Modifying throttle value (on any migration job) 6. Changing of import state (offline -> online and vice-versa) when the import is stopped, paused 7. Verifying already completed import
Prerequisites:
1) Destination SVM and Igroup should be available 2) Destination FlexVol should be available 3) Ensure that FCP logical interface is available on all nodes 4) WFA Server: WFA 3.1 5) ONTAP Vsersion: 8.3.1 and above 6) UM Version: 6.3
entity.name: FLI Status And Restart

entity.description: Maps the LUN to all the initiators in the specified initiator group.
entity.name: LUN Map

entity.description: Creates a single unmapped LUN of foreign disk size on a Storage Virtual Machine.
entity.name: LUN Create by Size of Foreign Disk

entity.description: Information of a Foreign LUN Import relationship.
entity.name: Lun_Import

entity.description:
This command will monitor active LUN import operations on a given node.
If the number of active LUN import operations on the given node is below the specified limit, the command will return successfully. Otherwise the command will wait until the number of LUN import is below the limit.
entity.name: Wait for LUN Import and Verify

entity.description: Unmaps a Cluster-Mode LUN from an igroup.
entity.name: LUN Unmap

entity.description: Destroy the specified LUN. This operation will fail if the LUN is currently mapped and is online. The force option can be used to destroy it regardless of being online or mapped.
entity.name: LUN Delete
Disk_Path for query OnCommand Unified Manager_6.3

entity.description: This command used to change LUN state (offline -> online and online -> offline) on basis of 'ChangeState' selected. If ChangeState is 'offline' then -> Disables block-protocol accesses to the LUN. Mappings, if any, configured for the LUN are not altered. If ChangeState is 'online' then -> Re-enables block-protocol accesses to the LUN.
entity.name: Change LUN State

entity.description: This command used to perform different 'lun import' operations. 'create' - Create a LUN import relationship with the purpose of importing foreign disk data into the LUN 'delete' - Deletes the import relationship of the specified LUN or the specified foreign disk 'start' - Start the import for the specified LUN 'pause' - Pause the import for the specified LUN 'resume' - Resume the import for the specified LUN 'stop' - Stop and abort the import for the specified LUN. All import checkpoint data will be lost 'throttle' - Modify the max throughput limit for the specified import relationship 'verify-start' - Start the verification of the foreign disk and LUN data. The import admin/operational state must be stopped/stopped or started/completed. The verification does a block for block comparison of the LUN and foreign disk. If the verification detects a mismatch between the foreign disk and LUN then the verify will stop 'verify-stop' - Stop the verify for the specified LUN
entity.name: LUN Import

entity.description: Modify the attributes of storage-disk object. A true value indicates an array LUN has been designated as a foreign LUN and cannot be assigned
entity.name: Modify Storage Disk

entity.description: A set of workflows that help manage storage. This includes workflows for resizing storage, migrating volumes from their current locations to other storage systems and aggregates, and moving volumes non-disruptively in Cluster-Mode.
entity.name: Migration

pack.name: Foreign LUN Import

pack.author: NetApp
pack.description: The SLO workflow pack provides a framework for implementing SLOs. Using the SLO workflow pack, storage service providers can optimize utilization, performance modelling, trend analysis, and asset planning. This pack consists of nine workflows and enables you to define Service Levels Classes, Storage Service Level Classes, and Protection Service Level Classes, which can be associated with every provisioned volume and LUN. Service-based provisioning workflows enable you to provision LUN, or volume based on defined services. The workflows in the SLO pack should be executed in the following recommended sequence: (1) Service Catalog Initialization (Mandatory) (2) Manage Storage Service Level Class (Mandatory and Iterative) (3) Manage Protection Service Level Class (Optional) (4) Manage Service Level Class (Optional) (5) Manage Adaptive QoS Policy Configuration (Optional) (6) Adaptive QoS Service Manager (Mandatory) (7) Service Based Volume Provisioning (Optional and Iterative) (8) Provisioning LUN Based on a Service Level (Optional and Iterative) (9) Move Volumes to a New Storage Service Level Class (Optional and Iterative) Caution NetApp strongly recommends that the customer attend the Service Design Workshop (SDW) conducted at their site before using this Pack. Please contact your account team to schedule the SDW. Using this pack without attending the SDW, is done so at the risk of the Customer and against NetApp's recommendation.

Workflow will understand the PSLC topology and prepares entire protection setup for volume as per given topology.

entity.name: KP Setup

entity.description:
This workflow will provide following functionalities 1) Define a new SSLC 2) Update existing SSLC 3) Remove existing SSLC 3) Remove Aggregate from SSLC
Workflow will allow following set of values for every SSLC i. IOPS throttle (IOPS/TB) ii. initial IOPS throttle iii. Dedupe enabled/disabled iv. Compression enabled v. Thick or Thin Provisioing
IOPS throttle and initial IOPS throttle setting will be used by Adaptive QoS Policy manager service to handle performance of the volume provisioned using service based volume provisioing workflow
Workflow will list down available aggregates. Select one or more aggregates to map it to specific SSLC.
Mapped aggregate list allow you to remove one or more aggregates from SSLC.
Note : This workflow is mandatory workflow to setup environment. Use this workflow for mapping aggregates to Storage service levels
entity.name: Manage Storage Service Level Class

entity.description:
This workflow will provide following functionalities 1) Define a new SSLC 2) Update existing SSLC 3) Remove existing SSLC 3) Remove Aggregate from SSLC
Workflow will allow following set of values for every SSLC i. IOPS throttle (IOPS/TB) ii. initial IOPS throttle iii. Dedupe enabled/disabled iv. Compression enabled v. Thick or Thin Provisioing
IOPS throttle and initial IOPS throttle setting will be used by Adaptive QoS Policy manager service to handle performance of the volume provisioned using service based volume provisioing workflow
Workflow will list down available aggregates. Select one or more aggregates to map it to specific SSLC.
Mapped aggregate list allow you to remove one or more aggregates from SSLC.
Note : This workflow is mandatory workflow to setup environment. Use this workflow for mapping aggregates to Storage service levels

entity.description:
This workflow will help in creating a Service Level Class with specific Storage Service and Protection Service.
Note : This workflow is not mandatory workflow. "Service Catalog Initialization" adds some SLCs, Use this workflow only when you want new SLC with different conbination of SSLC and PSLC
entity.name: Managing Service Level Class

entity.description:
This workflow will manage protection service level. Following functionalities are provided with this workflow 1) You can Add new Protection Service Level Class(PSLC) 2) You can Remove a Protection Service Level Class 3) You can Update the Protection Service Level Class 3) You can Add an Edge to a PSLC topology, Modify existing Edge in a topology and Remove an Edge in a topology OR Select "No Edge' when only primary retention policy is required
Note : 'Service Catalog Initialization' workflow will add 5 protection service level classes. Use this workflow to edit parameters of those services or for adding NEW PSLC
entity.name: Manage Protection Service Level Class

pack.name: Service Level Objective

pack.author: Dave Korns and Mirko Van Colen
pack.description: The EDM-Pack includes a general-purpose Data Source that can read from a Microsoft Excel spreadsheet directly into a WFA custom scheme and dictionaries. Those dictionary tables are then available to workflows for search and selection in user interface Queries, Filters, Finders, and Commands. This allows workflows to align with customer business rules, organization and environmental information. In addition, a workflow is included which will export an existing WFA scheme to an Excel spreadsheet allowing viewing and reporting of data within the WFA Cache Database.

entity.description: Storage systems and which site they are located in
entity.name: storage

entity.description: This workflow should be run immediately after importing the EDM dar file. The workflow installs the prerequisite modules (i.e.; PSExcel.zip) and places the EDM sample edm.xlsx into C:\Temp.
entity.name: EDM000 Pack Initialization

entity.description: Workflows associated with the EDM Package
entity.name: Excel Data Management

entity.description: Install or Remove the PSExcel Module Library into WFA's PoSH module path
entity.name: EDM Manage PSExcel

entity.description: Places a file into a target directory. If the target directory does not exist it creates it.
entity.name: EDM Place File into Directory
EDM Export MySql Database to Excel

entity.description: This workflow exports a WFA Cache Database Scheme to an Excel file for external viewing or reporting.
entity.name: EDM100 Export Scheme to Excel

entity.description: Sites where Data Centers are located
entity.name: site

pack.name: EDM-Pack

pack.author: NetApp
pack.description: The SLO workflow pack provides a framework for implementing SLOs. Using the SLO workflow pack, storage service providers can optimize utilization, performance modelling, trend analysis, and asset planning. This pack consists of nine workflows and enables you to define Service Levels Classes, Storage Service Level Classes, and Protection Service Level Classes, which can be associated with every provisioned volume and LUN. Service-based provisioning workflows enable you to provision LUN, or volume based on defined services. The workflows in the SLO pack should be executed in the following recommended sequence: (1) Service Catalog Initialization (Mandatory) (2) Manage Storage Service Level Class (Mandatory and Iterative) (3) Manage Protection Service Level Class (Optional) (4) Manage Service Level Class (Optional) (5) Manage Adaptive QoS Policy Configuration (Optional) (6) Adaptive QoS Service Manager (Mandatory) (7) Service Based Volume Provisioning (Optional and Iterative) (8) Provisioning LUN Based on a Service Level (Optional and Iterative) (9) Move Volumes to a New Storage Service Level Class (Optional and Iterative) Caution NetApp strongly recommends that the customer attend the Service Design Workshop (SDW) conducted at their site before using this Pack. Please contact your account team to schedule the SDW. Using this pack without attending the SDW, is done so at the risk of the Customer and against NetApp's recommendation.
